1902350.book: Description Of The Joking Of Rasoolullah
1902350.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1902350
In-book reference  : Book 35, Hadith 001
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 35, Hadith 001
1902350.text: Anas ibn Malik said: "The Prophet (Allah bless him and give him peace) said to him: 'O two-eared'!”

1902360.book: Description Of The Joking Of Rasoolullah
1902360.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1902360
In-book reference  : Book 35, Hadith 002
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 35, Hadith 002
1902360.text: Anas ibn Malik said (may Allah be well pleased with him): "Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace) would associate so closely with us that he said to a young brother of mine: “O Abu 'Umair, what has the little red- beaked sparrow done?’”

1902370.book: Description Of The Joking Of Rasoolullah
1902370.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1902370
In-book reference  : Book 35, Hadith 003
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 35, Hadith 003
1902370.text: Abu Huraira said (may Allah the Exalted be well pleased with him): “They said: ‘O Messenger of Allah, are you teasing us?’ He said: ‘Yes, except that I am telling nothing but the truth'!”

1902380.book: Description Of The Joking Of Rasoolullah
1902380.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1902380
In-book reference  : Book 35, Hadith 004
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 35, Hadith 004
1902380.text: Anas ibn Malik said: "A man asked Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace) to provide him with a mount, so he said: 'I will mount you on the offspring of a she-camel The man said: 'O Messenger of Allah, what shall I do with the offspring of a she- camel?' He said (Allah bless him and give him peace): 'To what does a she-camel give birth, except more she-camels?’”

1902390.book: Description Of The Joking Of Rasoolullah
1902390.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1902390
In-book reference  : Book 35, Hadith 005
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 35, Hadith 005
1902390.text: Anas ibn Malik said: “There was a man among the people of the desert — his name was Zahir — and he used to bring the Prophet (Allah bless him and give him peace) a present from the desert, so the Prophet (Allah bless him and give him peace) would equip him when he wished to go out to battle. “The Prophet said (Allah bless him and give him peace):‘Zahir is our desert, and we are his towns'. He (Allah bless him and give him peace) used to love him, though he was a homely man, so the Prophet (Allah bless him and give him peace) came to him one day while he was selling his wares, and embraced him from behind so that he couldn't see who it was. So he said: ‘Who is this? Let go of me!’ Then he turned around and recognized the Prophet (Allah bless him and give him peace). Once he recognized the Prophet (Allah bless him and give him peace), he kept his back pressed to the Prophet's chest, so the Prophet (Allah bless him and give him peace) proceeded to say: ‘Who will buy this slave?’ The man said: ‘O Messenger of Allah, in that case, by Allah, you will find me an unsellable commodity!’ The Prophet said (Allah bless him and give him peace): ‘But you are not an unsaleable commodity in the view of Allah),’ or he said: ‘You are precious to Allah!'”

1902400.book: Description Of The Joking Of Rasoolullah
1902400.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1902400
In-book reference  : Book 35, Hadith 006
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 35, Hadith 006
1902400.text: Al-Hasan Al-Basri said: "An old woman came to the Prophet (Allah bless him and give him peace) and said: 'O Messenger of Allah, beseech Allah to let me enter the Garden of Paradise!' He replied: 'O Mother of So-and-so, no old woman will enter the Garden of Paradise!' She turned away weeping, so he said: 'Tell her that she will not enter it as an old woman, for Allah says: ‘We have created them a new creation, and made them virgins, loving, equal in age [inna ansha’na-hunna insha’a: fa-ja'alna-hunna abkara 'uruban atraba].’” (Al-Qur'an; 56:35-37)
